articles.title: AIG Valuation Check After 14% Monthly Gain and 5-Year Shareholder Returns Doubling

articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: AIG Valuation Check After 14% Monthly Gain and 5-Year Shareholder Returns Doubling. American International Group (AIG) has been quietly rewarding patient shareholders, with the stock climbing about 14% over the past month and more than doubling over 5 years, even as growth remains steady rather than explosive. See our latest analysis for American International Group. Zooming out, that 13.99% 1 month share price return adds to a solid year to date rise. articles.title: Has AIG’s 161% Five Year Surge Fully Reflected Its Restructuring Progress?
articles.mainIdea: Has AIG’s 161% Five Year Surge Fully Reflected Its Restructuring Progress?
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: Has AIG’s 161% Five Year Surge Fully Reflected Its Restructuring Progress?. Wondering if American International Group at around $86 is still a smart buy, or if the easy money has already been made, you are not alone. The stock has climbed 2.4% over the last week, 14.0% over the past month, and is now up 18.6% year to date and 161.2% over five years. This naturally raises the question of whether the current price fully reflects that momentum.
